sense.name: a loud noise
sense.commentary: CLASH[+event][+acoustic][+noise][+loud] Note: implies the event of hearing a sound
sense.examples: The clash of the symbols could be heard above the rest of the orchestra. There was a great clash of thunder.

sense.name: state of disagreement
sense.commentary: CLASH[+state][+social][+disagreement] Note: does not imply physical fighting (Sense 4)
sense.examples: There was a bitter clash in the senate over the proposed health care bill. Their marriage was strained by their clash of religious viewpoints. The clash of their personalities made working together difficult.

sense.name: a mismatch, usually aesthetic
sense.commentary: CLASH[+state][+mismatch] Note: refers to unpleasing or conflicting colors, patterns, forms
sense.examples: The clash between John's plaid pants and paisley shirt was unflattering. The yellow drapes created a clash with the softer neutral tones of the room. A clash in everyone's schedules prevented setting up a meeting this week. (mismatch)

sense.name: a physical fight, skirmish
sense.commentary: CLASH[+event][+confrontation][+fight] Note: refers to a physical confrontation
sense.examples: His paintings depict the clash of great armies on battlefields. The clashes between the two drug gangs have resulted in several deaths. There were reports of minor clashes with security forces.
